advertisement

Penn State mens soccer defender Grady Renfrow knows what it feels like to not be able to play his favorite sport PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Renfrow sophomorebusiness said the key to his recovery was his positive attitude and defiant stance in the face of the disease PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Although he redshirted this past season Renfrows return to the soccer team was a feat of determination PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Renfrow said at this years Interfraternity CouncilPanhellenic Dance Marathon he used his experiences to communicate with and relate to the Four Diamonds children and families on a different level PERIOD

 Renfrow said PERIOD 

At noon Saturday Rec Halls South Gym was filled with Penn State athletes who came together for the Athlete Hour where Penn State athletes interact and play with Four Diamonds children and their families PERIOD

Many Penn State sports teams were represented including the football field hockey volleyball dance tennis and golf teams as well as the cheerleading squad PERIOD

Penn State football player Nick Daise juniorturfgrass science tossed a ball to a different kind of teammate  a child who was giggling and barely grazed four feet tall PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

The South Gym was buzzing with action as each team played a different sport or worked activity booths PERIOD

Tessa Rivera an 11yearold Four Diamonds child shouted  as she ran around a circle of womens soccer team players PERIOD

 Ed Rivera Tessas father said PERIOD

 he added PERIOD
